welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Have you ever visited a website and noticed the colors or fonts really stand out? What do you think makes them consistent across the entire site?” Students write a 2-sentence response and share with a partner.

aim.data: Objective: Students will learn how to use CSS custom properties (variables) and link external fonts using Google Fonts to create more maintainable and visually appealing websites.

review.data: Review how students applied internal and external stylesheets to apply colors and typography across a single page. Ask: “What happens if you want to change a site-wide color or font style in multiple places? How could you make that easier?”

relevant.data: Mini-lecture and demo in WebStorm: Introduce syntax for CSS variables in :root, use with var(), and benefits. Demonstrate Google Fonts import via <link> and usage with font-family.

interactive.data: Students fork starter HTML and CSS files. Implement at least three CSS variables, apply a Google Font, and style a button using one of the variables.

ownership.data: Students customize styles with at least one additional variable (e.g., border radius, link color). Push site to GitHub Pages and submit link on Canvas.

resonate.data: Exit Ticket: “What is one way CSS variables make site design easier or better?” Students reflect on how fonts/colors can be reused across a site.

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, internet access for Google Fonts, GitHub accounts, starter files (HTML and CSS), projector or screen for demo.
